events.title: Iraq War (2003-2011)
events.summary: US-led invasion and occupation of Iraq based on false claims of WMDs. Resulted in massive civilian casualties, sectarian violence, and regional destabilization. Conservative estimates place Iraqi civilian deaths at over 500,000, with some studies suggesting over 1 million total excess deaths.
events.source: Lancet Study, Iraq Body Count, Brown University Costs of War Project

events.title: Afghanistan War (2001-2021)
events.summary: 20-year US military intervention in Afghanistan following 9/11. Led to massive civilian casualties from airstrikes, night raids, and indirect effects of war. Brown University estimates over 176,000 total deaths including 46,000+ civilians.
events.source: Brown University Costs of War Project, UN Assistance Mission

events.title: Gulf War (1991)
events.summary: US-led coalition war against Iraq following invasion of Kuwait. Extensive bombing campaign targeted civilian infrastructure including water treatment plants, power stations, and hospitals. Estimated 100,000-200,000 Iraqi military and civilian deaths.
events.source: Beth Osborne Daponte (Census Bureau), Medical Educational Trust

events.title: Iraq Sanctions (1990-2003)
events.summary: Comprehensive economic sanctions imposed on Iraq that devastated civilian population. UN estimates over 500,000 children under 5 died due to sanctions-related malnutrition and lack of medical supplies. Madeleine Albright infamously said the deaths were 'worth it'.
events.source: UNICEF, UN Food and Agriculture Organization

events.title: Syria Intervention (2014-present)
events.summary: US military intervention in Syria including airstrikes, support for rebel groups, and occupation of oil-rich regions. Thousands of civilian casualties from US airstrikes, particularly in Raqqa and other ISIS-held areas.
